intro: Claytonia humboldtiana, commonly known as the Humboldt's springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, oval leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
